title: Analyzing Primary Sources: Civil War Era
objective: Students will analyze primary sources to evaluate historical claims

vocabulary.definition: A personal preference or prejudice that affects how someone views information
vocabulary.example: A soldier writing a letter home might show bias toward his own side in the war

vocabulary.definition: How trustworthy or accurate a source of information is
vocabulary.example: A diary entry written on the day of an event is more reliable than a story told years later

vocabulary.definition: An original document from the time period
The particular way someone sees or understands a situation based on their position and experiences
vocabulary.example: A Union soldier and a Confederate soldier would have different perspectives on the same battle

activities.name: Document Analysis Practice
instructions: Read the Civil War letter carefully
Identify the speaker, occasion, audience, and purpose
Write a 2-paragraph response explaining whether the source is reliable
sentence_frames: The speaker of this document is _____ because _____.
The audience for this document was _____ because _____.
The purpose of this document was to _____ (persuade/inform/entertain).
Evidence from the document that supports my thinking is: _____.

questions: Why is it important to evaluate source reliability?
